name: places/ChIJ7bEKWxZawokR4ez4Ir2Qzwo
formattedAddress: 1 Hanover St Fl 1, New York, NY 10005, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 Hanover St Fl 1, New York, NY 10005, USA

originalText.text:
Absolute terrible service. If you come in here with your dog expect to have a guy tell you that they can't accept anything you're mailing out.

I was in line getting ready to mail something out and a guy behind the counter said, "We can't accept your mail." I asked why and he said that there are signs saying that there are no dogs allowed in the building.
It's not like my dog was handling the mail. My dog was creating no fuss, he was quiet the entire time!  It was ridiculous and incredibly rude.
You know the post office is in the wrong when other customers defend the person with the dog.

originalText.text:
He is very unkind. "This is not what I sent, and I am not responsible for it," he said clearly. It's a shame because the other staff here are very kind. His awareness and level of work is very low. And finally, when I asked his name, he shook his head, ran away from me, and didn't even deal with the next customer. Then, when I went to another post office, they responded immediately and there was no problem.

You should reconsider hiring people who make fun of people and have no sense of responsibility for their work.

originalText.text:
Had no problem at this location sending certified mail. Poeple are helpful and fast in service. Also there are few self-service points if you do not want to interact with staff. One even is located on the back enter so you would not see anyone from the staff at all.
Postcards, gift cards and examples are all in place as usual.

originalText.text: Mrs.Knight was extremely rude before I even said a word to her. She yelled at me, belittled me and said to get out for simply walking in with my dog. I had to take my dog for a walk and thought I would drop off a package while I'm at it. I say okay go outside and get someone to hold my dog for me while I go back in to quickly drop off the package. She rolled her eyes, gave me an attitude and was being extremely condescending as I have her the barcode. I just left and told myself I'd find another location to drop my package off at another day. Never go here. Instantly ruined my day.

Never go here. Instantly ruined my day.

originalText.text: There’s a woman that works the front desk with black braids. No idea what her name is but from the rest of the reviews this is the same woman everyone else has been reporting on these reviews. I have a service dog wand she yelled at me to leave the building immediately and wouldn’t let me return my package. She yelled so loud at me it embarrassed me in front of the other customers. Before she yelled at me she was yelling at another man about something. Why is she still employed there if she’s constantly yelling and being insanely rude to customers. Can she be reported?? This was a really upsetting experience for me and my service dog.  I’ll never go to that USPS store again because I don’t want to be harassed anymore by that woman.
